Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.wpi.cs.wpisuitetng.modules.AbstractModel
      • edu.wpi.cs.wpisuitetng.modules.planningpoker.models.observers.ObservableModel

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    edu.wpi.cs.wpisuitetng.modules.Model, AbstractModelObserver

    public class Game
extends ObservableModel
implements AbstractModelObserver
    Basic Game class that contains the data to be store for a Game
    Author:
    jonathanleitschuh

    boolean hasTimeLimit,
    boolean usesCards)
        Constructs a Game without a creation time
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the game
        description - the description of the game
        requirements - the list of requirements for the game
        hasTimeLimit - checks if game has a time limit
        usesCards - checks if the game uses cards or text entry

      • Game

        public Game(java.lang.String name,
    java.lang.String description,
    java.util.ArrayList<Requirement> requirements,
    boolean hasTimeLimit,
    boolean usesCards,
    java.util.Date creationTime)
        Constructs a Game with a creation time
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the game
        description - the description of the game
        creator - the name of the user who created the game
        hasTimeLimit - checks if game has a time limit
        requirements - the list of requirements for the game
        usesCards - checks if the game uses cards or text entry
        creationTime - the data and time a game is created on

        Description copied from interface: AbstractModelObserver

      • hasChanged

        public boolean hasChanged()
        hasChanged in the super class does not check if the requirements has been changed. This method is to check whether if the requirements are also changed.
        Overrides:

        Returns:
        See Also:
